title: (x) Unicase didone on Henry Bendel packaging - (similar to) Perla {Lauri}
content:
I couldn't quite nail this one down, I'd appreciate any help. Sorry for the low res. Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [identify.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113203938/http:/typophile.com/files/identify_0.jpg) | 43.82 KB |
author: robsayshowdy

comments.content: That looks like [Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113203938/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=795) by Gareth Hague/ [T.26](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113203938/http:/typophile.com/wiki/T.26).

that's not it.

Emigre's Filosofia Unicase is closer, but still not right.  
 [http://www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PFilU.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113203938/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PFilU.html "http://www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PFilU.html")
Yeah, I agree. If it would help, the edges appear roughed - and not just because of the quality of ink/printing. I'm very sure it is a feature of the face. Hope that helps. Thanks.

wow I'm an idiot.

the font is Perla. I was only looking at the alternate. The regular is a perfect match.

Forrest,

Not at all!

When I linked to the Perla family, it shows the alternate in the preview instead of the regular one. I should've changed the link to show the [regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113203938/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=795&dw=2616) form.

It's still not Perla though. We've run into the Henry Bendel packaging before and came to the conclusion that -- while the type resemble Perla quite a bit -- a lot of inconsistencies in the character shapes make us believe they are in fact hand lettered.
Perla and Filosofia Unicase are wonderful alternatives though, so please don't mind me. :-)
